title: The battle for Pokrovsk enters its final phase
subhed: Russian infantry are advancing inside the city, one of the last major urban centers in the Donetsk region still under Kyiv's control. Moscow's shift in tactics – focusing on destroying Ukrainian logistics – has paid off after six months.

title: In Latvia, public mobilization continues to grow in support of the Istanbul Convention for preventing violence against women
subhed: Latvian lawmakers voted on October 30 to withdraw from the Istanbul Convention. Since then, the president has called for a review of the bill, as protests are planned across the country on Thursday.

title: COP30: Optimistic Brazil seeks to secure concrete progress on climate action
byline: By Bruno Meyerfeld (Rio de Janeiro (Brazil) correspondent)
subhed: The South American giant hopes to bridge emerging and wealthy nations, focusing on enforcing past COP pledges. But Brazil will need strong diplomacy to keep climate cooperation alive amid global tensions.

title: Secluded Kalash tribe fights for survival in Pakistan
subhed: This ethnic and religious minority now numbers just 4,000 members and faces intrusive tourism and the degradation of their environment, which is essential to their survival.

title: 'There's almost no water left': On the front lines of climate change in southern France
subhed: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (6/6). Persistent drought, record temperatures, wildfires: Faced with the most acute effects of global warming, residents of the Aude department in southern France are looking for ways to keep their region alive.

title: US Democrats, defeated by Trump a year ago, grapple with a grassroots rebellion
subhed: As Tuesday's special elections approach, the party is fractured, with no clear leader or unified message, as activists push for new priorities and a shake-up of its entrenched establishment.

title: Understanding Shein's sex doll scandal in five questions
